stream_context.summary: Kaze works on the Wild-West course: finishes a secret mine-cart mission, begins the Monty Mole bank-robbery mission, designs an old-man Koopa banker NPC, and prototypes a fake/ breakable boulder entrance.  In parallel he tests a brand-new global collision/step system and shows smaller tech such as auto-sizing text boxes.

development_findings.summary: Kaze rewrote Mario’s entire collision/step system; the new version binary-searches for the largest valid step, uses ray-casts for speed, verifies floor/ceiling space, and is already faster and more robust but still has ceiling-bonk and rollout bugs.
development_findings.quote: Once my new collision system is done, this game will be so nice collision-wise… I started on this yesterday and none of the steps you see right now has anything to do with Mario 64 physics any more.

development_findings.summary: Spin-jump animation now references Mario’s down-B from Smash Melee; Zeina created the base animation and Kaze polished it.
development_findings.quote: The closest you have to an official version of the spin jump from 1996 is Mario's Down-B from Smash Melee, so I went with that one.

development_findings.summary: Finished scripting the secret mine-cart chase mission (bar -> hidden door -> shy-guy carts); current crashes are due to unfinished collision rewrite.
development_findings.quote: Imagine this, but without the crash – the crash is because of my new collision functions.

development_findings.summary: New auto-sizing text-box routine finds the needed box size at run-time, easing localisation.
development_findings.quote: If I make him sing something it will automatically find the right size to encapsulate the text. Biobak, you're gonna like this a lot if you want to translate the game.

development_findings.summary: No traditional 100-coin stars; Yoshi coins replace that mechanic, aligning with Yoshi’s Island theme.
development_findings.quote: There are no 100 coins in this. The Yoshi coins replace the 100 coin stars.

development_findings.summary: Wild-West ‘bank robbery’ mission planning: player must locate a tunnel dug by Monty Moles, hidden behind a breakable boulder (will require Bomb cap or ground-pound); particle trail and banker dialogue give hints.
development_findings.quote: I think a breakable boulder would solve this… you need to ground-pound the boulder to get in here.

development_findings.summary: Koopa banker NPC designed: black shell, glasses, greying beard; Kaze adds vertex/texture work to create an ‘old man’ look and plans optional cane prop.
Bulletin-board asset pipeline: Zeina draws posters, Kaze converts to fog-shaded decals and fixes Fast64’s default ‘environment’ setting that caused wrong rendering.
development_findings.quote: If you default something to environment it actually will render wrong… I ruined it.

development_findings.summary: Course ordering under review: considers moving Wild-West course to 13 and adjusting pacing between ‘Mario-centric’ and ‘natural’ levels.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values Mario 64’s movement but dislikes its ‘placeless’ level design; aims for stronger thematic identity.
context_findings.quote: A lot of them just exist and they don't really feel like anything. What's your guys' favorite Mario 64 level?

context_findings.summary: He works from a cold North-American basement; heater noise disrupts streams, showing home-work overlap.
context_findings.quote: All I want to be is in my basement in silence, making Mario… but the heater is ruining my stream once again.

context_findings.summary: Discusses weight-loss and muscle mass, indicating significant personal time on health alongside development.
context_findings.quote: If I lost 50 pounds I would either lose a lot of muscle or literally die… I'm cutting down to 205 pounds right now.

context_findings.summary: Humorous yet conscious of legal risk: posts ‘Wanted for DMCA violation’ poster and jokes about not paying for Project 64 after malware controversy.

biobak.summary: Kaze highlights that the auto-sizing text system will help Biobak with future translations.

badub.summary: Music is being created; release timing undecided.
badub.quote: You have to ask Badub whenever he feels like it.

zeina.summary: Created base spin-jump animation and multiple textures; collaborates on Wild-West assets (posters, banker Koopa, potential cane).
zeina.quote: Zeina made the animation and I just polished it up a little bit.

zeina.summary: Occasional texture-pack oversights (‘forgot to bundle the textures’) and upstairs noise become light-hearted stream banter, revealing home–work overlap.

key_stories.title: Collision System Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Fed up with legacy glitches, Kaze begins a ground-up rewrite of Mario 64’s collision. In less than a day he has a faster, ray-cast-aided system running in the hack, though ceiling checks still fail.
key_stories.challenge: Original SM64 collision allows multiple clips and is slow; ray-cast attempt had other issues.
key_stories.process: Implements binary search for largest valid step, uses ray-casts for acceleration, removes all original step code.
key_stories.outcome: Game now runs on new system; visible improvement but remaining bugs to squash.
key_stories.key_quote: None of the steps you see right now has anything to do with Mario 64 physics any more.

key_stories.title: Spin Jump Inspiration
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted a fresh spin-jump look. Realising Smash Melee’s down-B was the only semi-official precedent, he and Zeina adapted it for N64 constraints.
key_stories.process: Referenced Melee; Zeina animates; Kaze tweaks polygons.
key_stories.key_quote: The closest you have to an official version… is Mario's Down-B from Smash Melee, so I went with that one.

key_stories.title: Mine-Cart Mission Crash
key_stories.summary: A completed secret chase set-piece shows well in testing until the new collision code crashes the game, forcing immediate triage.
key_stories.challenge: Integrating new physics into existing scripted event.
key_stories.process: Demonstrates mine-cart chase; identifies collision crash.
key_stories.outcome: Mission logic proven but collision fix pending.
key_stories.key_quote: Imagine this, but without the crash – the crash is because of my new collision functions.

key_stories.title: Designing the Bank Heist
key_stories.summary: Kaze iterates live on how players discover Monty Mole’s tunnel: dialog hints, particle trails, and finally a breakable boulder requiring a Bomb cap.
key_stories.challenge: Prevent players from stumbling in accidentally while still making clue-based discovery satisfying.
key_stories.process: Debates cardboard cut-out cloth, decides on bombable rock; copies WF boulder, edits texture.
key_stories.outcome: Clear plan for mission entrance implemented in editor.
key_stories.key_quote: A breakable boulder would solve this… you need to ground-pound the boulder to get in here.

key_stories.title: Dynamic Text Boxes for Localization
key_stories.summary: Kaze codes an auto-sizing message box system to ease future translations; showcases it with banker Koopa dialogue.
key_stories.challenge: Fixed-size boxes limited text length and localization.
key_stories.outcome: Boxes now resize per line count; translators cheer.
key_stories.key_quote: It will automatically find the right size to encapsulate the text.
